oai_dc:dc.dc:title: State Colored Teacher's Institute Program
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One page program for a State Teachers' Institute to be held at Fisk University. Topics for discussion as well as speakers are included on the program.

After the Freedmen's Bureau ceased to exist in 1872, many of the African American schools it had helped to support were taken over by the State. To provide further teacher training, State Teachers' Institutes or workshops were occasionally held. Despite this addition, Tennessee's African American public schools remained inadequate.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fisk University; African American educators; African American schools; African American history
Elementary school teaching; Teaching; Teachers
